item.title: Illegal border crossings fell in July to lowest level in four years
item.dc:creator: Maria Sacchetti, Nick Miroff
item.description: Border agents tallied 56,408 illegal crossings in July, a 32 percent decline from June and the fifth straight month that the figure has fallen, data shows.

item.title: West Bank village mourns resident killed in settler attack
item.dc:creator: Heidi Levine, Miriam Berger
item.description: The attack late Thursday in Jit in the northern West Bank was the latest in a string of assaults by settlers on Palestinian communities.

item.title: Why Indonesia moved its capital to a jungle hundreds of miles away
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The new city, Nusantara, comes as Jakarta continues to sink at a record pace.

item.title: U.S. proposes final Gaza cease-fire plan, seeking agreement by next week
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset, Hazem Balousha
item.description: The United States, Qatar and Egypt said in a joint statement that a new cease-fire proposal was on the table, but they did not include any specifics on the deal.

item.title: Why Thailand’s new prime minister, its youngest ever, adds to old divides
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is just 37, but she is part of a long-running political dynasty.

item.title: Viral Olympic B-girl Raygun says the ‘hate’ has been ‘devastating’
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Australian Rachael Gunn’s breaking performance sparked a backlash, including an online petition that Olympic officials condemned as “misleading and bullying.”

item.title: The war in Gaza passes a bleak, bloody milestone
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Health authorities in Gaza say the death toll in the territory has surpassed 40,000 people. Meanwhile, Israel has stepped up its de facto capture of Palestinian land in the West Bank.

item.title: London street cleaner wins dream vacation in a contest made just for him
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: A beloved street sweeper in South London wasn’t allowed to accept a holiday trip gifted by his town, so a special “contest” just for him was set up instead.

item.title: Amid calls for new elections in Venezuela, opposition weighs next move
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Marina Dias
item.description: Opposition leaders are rejecting proposals to rerun the election last month in which Edmundo González won a landslide victory over President Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Ukraine offensive in Russia expands beyond Kursk region, soldiers say
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Tetiana Burianova, David Stern, Robyn Dixon
item.description: Ukraine’s intelligence service announced the detention of more than 100 Russian troops, in what it said amounted to the “largest mass capture” of enemy soldiers at one time.

item.title: Gaza cease-fire talks underway in Qatar without Hamas in attendance
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Louisa Loveluck, Adela Suliman, Frances Vinall, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Israel and the United States, with mediating partners Egypt and Qatar, resumed high-stakes negotiations in Doha over a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.

item.title: More than 40,000 killed in Israel’s war in Gaza, Health Ministry says
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger
item.description: The Gaza Health Ministry does not distinguish between civilians and combatants, but aid workers and experts say the 40,000 figure is probably an undercount.

item.title: Russia sentences American woman to 12 years for donation aiding Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The woman, Ksenia Karelina, a beautician living in Los Angeles, was visiting family in Russia when she was arrested at the airport over a donation of about $50 to an aid group.

item.title: Israel is redrawing the West Bank, cutting into a prospective Palestinian state
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Claire Parker, Sufian Taha , Lorenzo Tugnoli
item.description: Israeli land grabs, settlement expansion and demolitions in Palestinian communities mark the most significant territorial changes in the West Bank in decades.

item.title: What to know about Olympic boxer Imane Khelif’s cyberbullying complaint
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Victoria Bisset
item.description: French investigators are looking into charges including gender-based cyber harassment and public insult after the gold medalist was targeted in online attacks.

item.title: India pressed U.S. to go easy on Bangladeshi leader before her ouster, officials say
item.dc:creator: Gerry Shih, Ellen Nakashima, John Hudson
item.description: After Indian lobbying, Washington toned down its criticism of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Now both countries must confront whether they mishandled Bangladesh.
